questions.question: Which of the following is true about bonding molecular orbitals?

answers.a: They result from destructive interference of atomic orbitals
answers.b: They have higher energy than the original atomic orbitals
answers.c: They increase electron density between the nuclei

explanations.a: Incorrect. Destructive interference forms antibonding orbitals.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Bonding orbitals have lower energy.
explanations.c: Correct. Bonding orbitals increase electron density between the nuclei, stabilizing the molecule.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Bonding orbitals can have unpaired electrons depending on electron configuration.

questions.question: In a homonuclear diatomic molecule, which molecular orbital has the highest energy among the following?

explanations.a: Incorrect. σ(1s) is a low-energy bonding orbital.
explanations.b: Incorrect. σ*(1s) is higher than σ(1s) but lower than σ*(2p).
explanations.c: Incorrect. σ(2s) is a bonding orbital and lower in energy.
explanations.d: Correct. σ*(2p) is among the highest energy MOs in diatomic molecules.

questions.question: The bond order of N₂ molecule according to molecular orbital theory is:

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is the bond order of O₂, not N₂.
explanations.b: Incorrect. 2.5 would suggest fractional bonding not applicable to N₂.
explanations.c: Correct. N₂ has a bond order of 3, indicating a strong triple bond.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Bond order of 3.5 would not apply to N₂.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true for heteronuclear diatomic molecules?

answers.b: The more electronegative atom contributes more to bonding orbitals
answers.c: Bond order is always an integer
answers.d: There is no mixing of orbitals from different atoms

explanations.a: Incorrect. Orbital mixing depends on energy compatibility.
explanations.b: Correct. The more electronegative atom contributes more to bonding MOs.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Bond orders can be fractional in heteronuclear molecules.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Orbital mixing is fundamental to MO theory.

questions.question: Which pair is an example of a heteronuclear diatomic molecule?

explanations.c: Correct. HCl is made of hydrogen and chlorine — two different atoms.
